sentence.Network_en: The crash had spilled a noxious defoliant into the planet's ecology, ravaging the native flora.
sentence.Network_cn: 这次坠毁将一种有害的落叶剂洒入星球的生态系统中, 破坏着当地的植物群.

sentence.Network_en: Defoliant: Chemical dust or spray applied to plants to cause their leaves to drop off prematurely.
sentence.Network_cn: 落叶剂: 落叶剂是一种化学粉剂或喷洒剂,施于植物以使树叶提早掉落.

entry.def: A defoliant is a chemical used on trees and plants to make all their leaves fall off. Defoliants are especially used in war to remove protection from an enemy.

means.word_mean: 1. a chemical that is sprayed on plants and causes their leaves to fall off

auth_sentence.content: Agent Orange was a dioxin-laden defoliant that was sprayed over jungles to strip the Viet Cong of cover.
auth_sentence.res_content: Agent Orange was a dioxin-laden defoliant that was sprayed over jungles to strip the Viet Cong of cover.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Agent Orange was a dioxin-laden defoliant that was sprayed over jungles to strip the Viet Cong of cover.
